event.summary: 10/25/1993: Two people died and at least seven others were injured when suspected Maoist rebels detonated a powerful car bomb in the parking lot of Peru's Jorge Chavez International Airport. The bomb, placed under a minibus, exploded near the Departure area one person and injuring 20. The American Airlines cargo office sustained damage during the attack.
event.target1: Parking lot of Jorge Chavez International Airport
event.addnotes: This was one of three related attacks (cf. 199310260004-5).
event.scite1: "Bomb Kills 2 at Lima Airport In Raid Laid to Shining Path,” The New York Times, October 27, 1993.
event.scite2: "Killed, 7 Hurt In Peru Blast,” Newsday, October 26,1993.
event.scite3: "Bomb Attacks on Airport Car Park and Lima Municipal Office Reported,” British Broadcasting Corporation, October 29, 1993.
